meanings.definition: To search out and publicly expose real or apparent misconduct of a prominent individual or business.
meanings.sent1: The journalist was muckraking to uncover corruption in the government.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys muckraking to reveal the truth about dishonest companies.
meanings.sent3: The detective muckraking at the crime scene found the missing evidence.
meanings.sent4: Her determination in muckraking shone a light on the dark secrets of the industry.
meanings.sent5: Muckraking like a detective, she dug deep to find the hidden truth.

meanings.definition: The action of searching out and publicly exposing real or apparent misconduct of a prominent individual or business.
meanings.sent1: Muckraking can lead to positive changes in society by revealing wrongdoings.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper article was a prime example of muckraking in action.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a hilarious version of muckraking gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, muckraking is like shining a spotlight on hidden deeds.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted the power of muckraking in uncovering scandals.
